Hello,

I have a crawl with 150 seed URLs that is running for one day now a=
nd is getting slower and slower. After quite some research I assume that th=
e reason is that there are so many exhausted queues:

RUN - 3580 URI queues=
: 42 active (7 in-process; 0 ready; 35 snoozed); 0 inactive; 0 ineligible; =
0 retired; 3538 exhausted 

If I understand it correctly, an exhausted queu=
e is one that has no more URLs to crawl for the host. This means, I have on=
ly 42 hosts with uncrawled URIs left. But this can't be true since when I l=
ook into the hosts-report, one of the seed hosts has only 163 crawled URLs =
and does not appear to be in an active frontierany longer since I can not f=
ind it in the frontier-summary-report. Since this host should have way more=
 crawlable URLs, I wonder what went wrong. 
Is my assumption correct? How c=
an I inspect the exhausted queues? 

Robert
